Description: A player can target anyone with a hand with blaze. The target then shows any hand card of theirs. The player can then discard any hand card of the same suit to damage them one with fire.
Clarifications: The target selects the card from their hand to show, then puts it back into their hand.
Everyone can see the entire card, not just the suit.
After seeing the card, the player decides whether to discard a matching card to deal damage.
A player can target themselves with Blaze, but only if they have another card to discard.

Description: A player can target up to two players and toggles if they are in the chain. A second option is to discard the chains and draw another card.
Clarifications: Whenever any player in the chain takes elemental damage, all other members in the chain receive the same. After a player takes damage in the chain, they are restored out of the chain.
To indicate that a player is in the chain, their general card is placed in landscape orientation instead of portrait.
Being in or out of the chain is a toggle status; there is no connection between players added to the chain at the same time. All players in the chain are linked together.
The only way to leave the chain without taking damage is by using Chains.

When damage travels through the chain, it matches the element and amount received by the first player hit. Each subsequent player in the chain takes the same damage, which can be individually modified. For example, Cao Cao receives 2 fire damage; all other players in the chain take 2 fire damage as well. When it reaches Liu Bei, who has Wood Armor, his damage increases to 3 fire damage. This increase only affects Liu Bei. Sun Quan, with the Silver Helmet, takes only 1 damage, while Lu Bu takes 2 fire damage, the original amount.
Negate can only affect one player at a time. Other players must still enter the chain.
If a player trades in their Chains, this action cannot be negated, as it is not considered using the Chains.

Description: When attacked, a player plays this card to avoid taking damage.
Clarifications: This card is not used during a players turn under most circumstances.

Description: Once per turn, a player can use this to attack anyone in their attacking range. If the target does not use an Escape, they receive one unit of fire damage.
Clarifications: On a player’s turn, they can make a maximum of one attack. This includes all types of attacks, such as Fire Attack and Lightning Attack.
Whenever a player needs to use an Attack, they may use a Fire Attack as well.
Using an Fire Attack as part of another card, like Duel, does not count towards this limit and does not count as the player's attack for that turn.
There is no limit to the number of attacks a player can make outside of their own turn.

Description: Once per turn, a player can use this to attack anyone within their attacking range. If the target does not use an escape, they receive one unit of lightning damage.
Clarifications: On a player’s turn, they can make a maximum of one attack. This includes all types of attacks, such as Fire Attack and Lightning Attack.
Whenever a player needs to use an Attack, they may use a Lightning Attack as well.
Using an Lightning Attack as part of another card, like Duel, does not count towards this limit and does not count as the player's attack for that turn.
There is no limit to the number of attacks a player can make outside of their own turn.

Description: Any player can play this in response to any tool card being played.  The tool card then no longer works.
Clarifications: When Negate is used against a tool card with multiple targets, it only cancels the effect for one specific target.
Negate can be used both during and outside a player's turn. It can counter any tool card regardless of who played it or who the target is.
A player can use Negate on their own tool cards.
Negate can be used to counter another Negate. A second Negate can counter the first, and a third can counter the second, continuing this chain indefinitely.
To negate a delay tool card, Negate must be used at the time of judgment, not when the delay card is placed.

Description: During their turn, a player can use a peach to increase their health by one. Also when a player is on the brink of death, any player can use a peach to give them one unit of health.
Clarifications: A player cannot use a Peach to heal another player unless they're on the brink of death.

Description: Starvation
Clarifications: A Negate cannot be used when Starvation is placed on a player; it must be used before the judgment is made.
Starvation can be targeted by Break or Steal to prevent a player from suffering its adverse effects.
Any abilities that are activated during the drawing phase are lost if Starvation works, and they cannot be performed this turn.
A player cannot be targeted with Starvation if they already have one. Players can only have one of each pending card on them at any time.

Description: When a player is on the brink of death, that player can use play wine to restore one health. Also any player can play this card once during their turn. If they do, the damage of the next attack is increased by one.
Clarifications: When using Wine to boost damage, no health is restored.
Only the player on the brink of death can use Wine to restore their health.
If a player plays Wine and then ends their turn, the effects end. Their next attack will not deal increased damage.

Description: Once per turn, you can play this to attack any player within your attacking range. They must play an Escape or they suffer one damage.
Clarifications: On a player’s turn, they can make a maximum of one attack. This includes all types of attacks, such as Fire Attack and Lightning Attack.
Using an Attack as part of another card, like Duel, does not count towards this limit and does not count as the player's attack for that turn.
There is no limit to the number of attacks a player can make outside of their own turn.

Description: All other players play an attack or take one damage.
Clarifications: The person who played the Barbarians does not need to play an attack. They are also considered the source of all the damage.
All cards involved are discarded afterward.
When players use a Negate, it only affects one player. The other players must still participate.

Description: A player chooses a card from any other player and discards it.
Clarifications: There is no distance limitation for Break.
Break can target hand cards, equipment, and pending cards. When targeting a hand card, the player does not see the target’s hand; they simply select a random card to discard.
A player cannot use Break on themselves.

Description: Capture
Clarifications: A Negate cannot be used when Capture is placed on a player; it must be used during the judgment phase.
Capture can be removed by using Break or Steal, preventing the player from suffering its effects.
If Capture succeeds, any abilities that the player would normally perform during the action phase are lost and cannot be used for that turn.
A player cannot be targeted with another Capture if they already have one on them. They can only have one of each pending card at any time.

Description: A player targets any other player that possesses a weapon. Then, the player chooses any player within the targets attacking range. The target then can attack the victim. If the target does not, the player takes the targets weapon and puts it in his hand.
Clarifications: The target of this card must have a weapon.
The player can order the target to attack the player themselves, allowing the player to be the victim. However, the player cannot order themselves to attack another, being the target.
The target and victim are declared as soon as the card is played. The target then decides whether to attack.
Attacking abilities and weapon abilities can both be activated when the target attacks the victim.

Description: The player that plays this draws two cards from the deck.
Clarifications: Other players can use Negate to stop the drawing.

Description: A player can target anyone with this card. If the target does not play an attack, they are damaged. If they attack then the source must take damage or attack. Whoever does not attack, takes damage.
Clarifications: After a Duel, all attacks used are discarded.
There is no limit to the number of rounds in a Duel.

Description: When attacked, a player plays this card to avoid taking damage.
Clarifications: This card is not used during a players turn under most circumstances.

Name.Original: Hail of Arrows 万箭齐发

Description: All other players play an escape or take one damage.
Clarifications: The player who played the card does not need to use Escape.
When a player uses Negate, it only applies to one player. The other players must still participate.

Description: When a player uses this, one card is put face up for each living player. Then starting with the user of the card, each player chooses a card and puts it in their hand.
Clarifications: Every player must choose a card.
When a player uses Negate, it only affects one player. That player does not get to choose a card, but the other players must still participate.
The chosen card goes immediately into each player's hand, and they cannot use any cards until their turn.
Any leftover cards are discarded after one round of selection.

Description: Lightning
Clarifications: The player that uses Lightning is the first to pass under the judgment.
Lightning keeps traveling around the table until it hits someone unless it is targeted by Break or Steal.
A Negate cannot be used when this card is played, only before the judgment is made. When a Negate is used, the card moves to the player to the right.
A player cannot play a Lightning if they already have one on them. They can only have one of each pending card on them at any time.
If the Lightning moves to a player that already has one on them, it skips them and moves to the next player without a Lightning.

Clarifications: A player cannot use a Peach to heal another player unless they're on the brink of death.

Description: All damaged players recover one blood.
Clarifications: This cannot be used to save a player on the brink of death.

Description: A player chooses a card from another player within range and puts it in their hand.
Clarifications: Steal can only be used within the player's range. The target must be within range.
Hand cards, equipment cards, and pending judgment cards can all be targeted by Steal.
When stealing a hand card, the player does not get to see the opponent's hand. They randomly select one card to add to their own hand.
A player cannot use Steal on themselves.

Description: A player chooses a card from any other player and discards it.
Clarifications: There is no distance limitation for Break.
Break can target hand cards, equipment, and pending cards. When targeting a hand card, the player does not see the target’s hand; they simply select a random card to discard.
A player cannot use Break on themselves.

Description: A player chooses a card from another player within range and puts it in their hand.
Clarifications: Steal can only be used within the player's range. The target must be within range.
Hand cards, equipment cards, and pending judgment cards can all be targeted by Steal.
When stealing a hand card, the player does not get to see the opponent's hand. They randomly select one card to add to their own hand.
A player cannot use Steal on themselves.

Name.Original: Borrow Arrows Using Straw Boats 草船借剑

Description: This card targets a player with cards in their hand. The target may play an Attack.If it is a Fire Attack, the you take 1 fire damage.If the Attack is not a Fire Attack, the Attack is added to your hand.If the target does not play an Attack, they receive 1 damage.
Clarifications: The target has the option to not play an Attack, but they will suffer 1 damage from you as a consequence.
A Fire Attack played by the target does not go into the your hand.

Description: Any player can play this in response to any tool card being played.  The tool card then no longer works.
Clarifications: When Negate is used against a tool card with multiple targets, it only cancels the effect for one specific target.
Negate can be used both during and outside a player's turn. It can counter any tool card regardless of who played it or who the target is.

Name.Original: Eight Golden Doors 八门金锁

Description: Eight Golden Doors
Clarifications: A successful judgment grants the player completely unlimited reach for their entire turn. This surpasses the effects of horses and any other restrictions, allowing the player to target every other player with all cards.
Negate cannot be used when Eight Golden Doors is placed on a player; it can only be used during the judgment.
Eight Golden Doors can be removed by Break or Steal to prevent the player from gaining its effect.

Name.Original: Flooding Seven Armies 水淹七军

Description: Choose any other two players who are adjacent to each other. Both players may each play an Escape.If either player does not play an Escape, both players take 1 damage.
Clarifications: The two targets are prompted to play an Escape one by one, in the same order as their upcoming turns.
Even if the first player successfully plays an Escape, the second player failing to do so will still cause both players to take 1 damage.
The damage is sourced from the player who uses this card.
The user cannot target themselves or only one person. Therefore, this card cannot be used when only two players remain in the game.

Name.English: Scrape the Bone to Cure Poison
Name.Original: Scrape the Bone to Cure Poison 刮骨疗毒

Description: Any player may target another damaged player with this card. The target player is healed by 1, and the player using this card loses 1 health.
Clarifications: This card functions similarly to Sun Shangxiang's "Marriage."
It cannot target a player who is at full health.
The user may cause their own death by using this card.
Players cannot target themselves with this card.
It cannot be used to save a player from the brink of death.
The health loss caused by this card is not considered damage. As a result, abilities triggered by damage are not activated.

Description: Toxin
Clarifications: Poison damage counts as elemental damage and can transfer through Chains.
This card can be targeted by Break or Steal like any other delay tool card.
Negate can stop this card, but it must be used when the judgment occurs, not when the card is initially played.

Name.Original: Travel Alone, but Armed 单刀赴会

Description: This card can be used outside of a player's turn to nullify 1 unit of damage for any player within the user's attacking range.
Clarifications: This card cannot be used during the user's own turn.
If the damage consists of multiple units dealt simultaneously, this card reduces the damage by 1 unit.
